body_html:
@ebrevdo k, i'm going to build my docker image once more and try again, but i believe i still get the CUDA_ERROR_UNKNOWN when i launch the Tensorflow MNIST example.

From what I recall, the /dev/nvidia* devices were missing in the container on my last build, even though docker_run_gpu.sh maps those files. furthermore, i modified the docker gpu shell script to include the following bc these files seemed to be missing or inaccessible from the container.

# trying to make modprobe accessible
# - making this available makes modprobe accessible
# - but modprobe still can't find nvidia
export LIB_MODULES=$(\uname -r | xargs -I{} echo '-v /lib/modules/{}:/lib/modules/{}')

i will update again after the container builds.

body:
@ebrevdo k, i'm going to build my docker image once more and try again, but i believe i still get the `CUDA_ERROR_UNKNOWN` when i launch the Tensorflow MNIST example.  

From what I recall, the `/dev/nvidia*` devices were missing in the container on my last build, even though `docker_run_gpu.sh` maps those files.  furthermore, i modified the docker gpu shell script to include the following bc these files seemed to be missing or inaccessible from the container.

```
# trying to make modprobe accessible
# - making this available makes modprobe accessible
# - but modprobe still can't find nvidia
export LIB_MODULES=$(\uname -r | xargs -I{} echo '-v /lib/modules/{}:/lib/modules/{}')
```

i will update again after the container builds.
